primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The sinner must move from a state of procrastination/sin to a state of conversion/penance to avoid sudden judgment.

tekstueel_bewijs: you who always put off doing penance
heal your souls with the remedies of penitence

object.identificatie: Conversion/Penance (as a means to escape Damnation)
tekstueel_bewijs: the remedy for all your ills
his wrath will suddenly blaze forth
he will reject you on the day of his vengeance
so that you may present yourselves... not to be condemned

helper.rol_van_god: God is the Sender of the mandate and the Judge of the result, but the Hearer is the Subject of the action.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The primary enemy is the hearer's own psychology—the habit of delay—rather than an ontological power like Sin or Death that only God can conquer.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God's past action in creation and redemption (The Cross).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God/Christ
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: God's past action (Program 1) is used as a rhetorical motivation (Vouloir-faire) to compel the sinner's current action (Program 2). The sermon focuses on the sinner's response as the deciding factor.

voorbeelden_god_subject: he found you through the blood of his Son
voorbeelden_mens_subject: you who always put off doing penance

voorbeelden: why you’re in no hurry to receive what you yourself agree is good
Our frequent exhortations... have taught us
with the grace of God, heal your souls

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon assumes the hearer has the 'Pouvoir' (Power) and 'Savoir' (Knowledge) but lacks 'Vouloir' (Will) and 'Devoir' (Sense of Obligation). It is a recruitment to action.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from Niet-S1 (Procrastination) and Niet-S2 (Presumption) toward S1 (Conversion) by using S2 (Judgment) as a threat.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the human act of penance (S1) to avoid the divine act of judgment (S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. S2 is the primary engine of the sermon's urgency.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon mentions the blood of Christ, the functional Subject of the narrative is the Sinner. Grace is treated as an available 'remedy' that the human must apply to themselves.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: on the day a sinner turns away... I will not remember
heal your souls... so that you may present yourselves... to be crowned

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: when you lost your soul... he went searching for you

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Crow and the Dove are used as behavioral models for the hearer to imitate or avoid.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ as the true Dove who returns to the Father on our behalf when we were lost crows.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Anxiety and pressure to perform penance immediately.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is synergism where the human 'turn' is the decisive trigger for divine forgiveness.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is highly coherent as a call to action, but theologically incoherent regarding the sufficiency of Christ's work versus the necessity of almsgiving for 'healing'.
spanning_punten: God found you through the blood of His Son vs. You must heal your own soul with almsgiving.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: guaranteeing an eternal reward for good deeds

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is not mentioned as the source of the 'Pouvoir-faire'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is viewed as a series of debts (10 sins, 15 sins) rather than a dead state.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'Law' narrative where the Hearer is the Subject and God is the Judge/Object. Grace is a background condition rather than the active force.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The sinner is the one 'healing' the soul.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ the Subject of the healing.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Heal your souls with remedies,' use 'Christ, the Great Physician, has come to heal your soul; submit to His treatment.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Crow' who must become a 'Dove'.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Dead Man' whom God brings to life.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on the Ezekiel text: 'I do not wish the death of the sinner' as God's active pursuit.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that the desire to convert is itself a gift from God, not a human work.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Sin as a bondage that the sinner cannot break alone.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just 'waiting till tomorrow,' the solution is just 'willpower.' If the opponent is 'Death,' the solution must be 'God.'

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The secondary program (Ethics/Alms) is fused with the primary (Salvation).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has strong rhetorical urgency but risks leaving the hearer in a cycle of self-reliance and anxiety.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, this is a masterpiece of persuasion; semiotically, it is a legalistic engine.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the context of Ezekiel; Greimas shows how the text is used to assign 'Subject' status to the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Grace' is used as a modal competence (Savoir) for a human performance, rather than the performance itself.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Cras' (Crow) metaphor to create a psychological opponent, effectively shifting the focus from the Cross to the Hearer's calendar.
